page.title: 06Woodlands Around Wadborough.
page.content: There are three major woodland areas near Wadborough; Narrow Wood, Deerfold Wood and Croome Perry Wood. The footpaths that run through Narrow Wood and Deerfold Wood and around Croome Perry Wood were very muddy after a rainfall. The footpaths are also rather hard to follow. The three woods contain fir and beech trees. There is some tree felling going on in Deerfold Wood. The foxes, sqirrels, rabbits and partridges that live in the woods do not please the nearby farmers because they eat the farmers products. Callans Wood is part of Deerfold Wood. Some of the many wild flowers that are growing in the woods are: Hedge Mustard Restharrow, Clover, Bluebells,Daisies and Buttercups.
